title: Duke Criteria for Infective Endocarditis
desc: The Duke Criteria for Infective Endocarditis provides standardized diagnostic criteria for endocarditis.

orgreference.text: Durack DT, Lukes AS, Bright DK. New criteria for diagnosis of infective endocarditis: utilization of specific echocardiographic findings. Duke Endocarditis Service. Am J Med. 1994 Mar;96(3):200-9. PubMed PMID: 8154507.

other_refer.text: Li JS, Sexton DJ, Mick N, Nettles R, Fowler VG Jr, Ryan T, Bashore T, Corey GR. Proposed modifications to the Duke criteria for the diagnosis of infective endocarditis. Clin Infect Dis. 2000 Apr;30(4):633-8. Epub 2000 Apr 3. PubMed PMID: 10770721.

data.facts:
These are technically the “modified” or “revised” Duke Criteria, which were updated in 2000. The updates included:

  • “Possible” IE modified to include patients having 1 major and 1 minor criterion, or 3 minor criteria.
  • Nosocomially acquired Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia  also included.
  • Coxiella burnetii criteria mentioned above included.
  • Trans-esophageal echocardiography (TEE)  recommended for patients with prosthetic valves, rated at least “possible” by clinical criteria, or complicated IE (paravalvular abcess); Trans-thoracic echocardiography (TTE) in other patients.
  • Echocardiographic minor criteria eliminated.

inputs.subheading_instructions: If either is positive, diagnosis is definite (see Evidence for exceptions)

inputs.name: microorganisms
inputs.tips_en: Demonstrated by culture or histologic examination of a vegetation, a vegetation that has embolized, or an intracardiac abscess specimen.

inputs.name: lesions
inputs.tips_en: Vegetation or intracardiac abscess confirmed by histologic examination showing active endocarditis.

inputs.subheading_instructions: If both are positive, diagnosis is definite (see Evidence for exceptions)

inputs.name: endocarditis
inputs.tips_en: Typical microorganisms consistent with IE from 2 separate blood cultures, microorganisms consistent with IE from persistently positive blood cultures, single positive blood culture for Coxiella burnetii or antiphase I IgG antibody titer >1:800.

inputs.name: evidence_endocardial
inputs.tips_en: Echocardiogram positive for IE, abscess, new partial dehiscence of prosthetic valve, new valvular regurgitation. Note: Worsening or changing of pre-existing murmur NOT sufficient.

inputs.subheading_instructions: If all are positive, diagnosis is definite (see Evidence for exceptions)

inputs.label_en: Predisposing heart condition or injection drug use
inputs.name: heart_condition_injection_drug
vascular
inputs.tips_en: Major arterial emboli, septic pulmonary infarcts, mycotic aneurysm, intracranial hemorrhage, conjunctival hemorrhages, and Janeway’s lesions.

inputs.name: immunologic
inputs.tips_en: Glomerulonephritis, Osler’s nodes, Roth’s spots, and rheumatoid factor.

inputs.name: microbiological
inputs.tips_en: Positive blood culture but does not meet a major criterion as noted above or serological evidence of active infection with organism consistent with IE.
